intro: Galium parisiense var. trichocarpum, commonly known as the hairy woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on elongated pedicels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
